snippet: Even if a deal to end the shutdown is reached soon, the stalling of scientific research and the disruption of federal workers’ spending patterns could have a lasting impact.
abstract: Partial government shutdown is affecting far more than the nation’s monuments and parks; jobs deemed essential continue to be performed, but other tasks that have stalled, including scientific research, may take a lasting toll even if shutdown ends soon; temporary disruption of furloughed workers’ spending patterns are also likely to continue even after they go back to work and could inflict measurable damage to the nation’s growth rate.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL, MICHAEL D. SHEAR and SABRINA TAVERNISE

lead_paragraph: Even if a deal to end the shutdown is reached soon, the stalling of scientific research and the disruption of federal workers’ spending patterns could have a lasting impact.

headline.main: Shutdown’s Quiet Toll, From Idled Research to Closed Wallets
headline.print_headline: Shutdown’s Quiet Toll, From Idled Research To Closed Wallets
